info.title: SMSGate API
info.description: This API provides programmatic access to sending SMS messages on Android devices. Features include sending SMS, checking message status, device management, webhook configuration, and system health checks.

post.description:
Generate new access token with specified scopes and ttl

*Not available in Local Server mode*

delete.description:
Revoke access token with specified jti

*Not available in Local Server mode*

get.description: Checks if service is ready to serve traffic (readiness probe)

Retrieve a list of log entries within a specified time range.

*Not available in Cloud Server mode*

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the time range for the logs to retrieve. Logs created after this timestamp will be included.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end of the time range for the logs to retrieve. Logs created before this timestamp will be included.

get.description: Retrieves a list of messages with filtering and pagination

post.description: Enqueues a message for sending. If `deviceId` is set, the specified device is used; otherwise a random registered device is chosen.

parameters.name: deviceActiveWithin
parameters.description: Filter devices active within the specified number of hours

409.description: Message with such ID already exists

post.description: Initiates process of inbox messages export via webhooks. For each message the `sms:received` webhook will be triggered. The webhooks will be triggered without specific order.

get.description: Returns settings for a specific user

patch.description: Partially updates settings for a specific user

post.description: Registers webhook. If webhook with same ID already exists, it will be replaced

200.description: The server should return this HTTP status code if the data was received successfully.

get.description: Checks if service is running (liveness probe)
Checks if service is ready to serve traffic (readiness probe)
Checks if service has completed initialization (startup probe)

scopes.description: scopes for which the access token is valid

ttl.description: lifetime of the access token in seconds

expires_at.description: time at which the access token is no longer valid

id.description: unique identifier for the access token

checks.description: A map of check names to their respective details.

releaseId.description:
Release ID of the application.
It is used to identify the version of the application.

status.description:
Overall status of the application.
It can be one of the following values: "pass", "warn", or "fail".

description.description: A human-readable description of the check.

observedUnit.description: Unit of measurement for the observed value.

status.description:
Status of the check.
It can be one of the following values: "pass", "warn", or "fail".

context.description: Additional context information related to the log entry, typically including data relevant to the log event.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when this log entry was created.

id.description: A unique identifier for the log entry.

message.description: A message describing the log event.

module.description: The module or component of the system that generated the log entry.

priority.description: The priority level of the log entry.

phoneNumber.description: Phone number or first 16 symbols of SHA256 hash

deviceId.description: Optional device ID for explicit selection

id.description: ID (if not set - will be generated)

priority.description: Priority, messages with values greater than `99` will bypass limits and delays

simNumber.description: SIM card number (1-3), if not set - default SIM will be used

ttl.description: Time to live in seconds (conflicts with `ValidUntil`)

deviceId.description: DeviceID is the ID of the device to export messages for.

since.description: Since is the start of the time range to export.

until.description: Until is the end of the time range to export.

encryption.description: Encryption contains settings related to message encryption.

logs.description: Logs contains settings related to logging.

messages.description: Messages contains settings related to message handling.

ping.description: Ping contains settings related to ping functionality.

webhooks.description: Webhooks contains settings related to webhook functionality.

passphrase.description: Passphrase is the encryption passphrase. If nil or empty, encryption is disabled. Must not be used with Cloud Server.

lifetime_days.description:
LifetimeDays is the number of days to retain logs.
Must be at least 1 when provided.

limit_period.description:
LimitPeriod defines the period for message sending limits.
Valid values are "Disabled", "PerMinute", "PerHour", or "PerDay".

limit_value.description:
LimitValue is the maximum number of messages allowed per limit period.
Must be at least 1 when provided.

log_lifetime_days.description:
LogLifetimeDays is the number of days to retain message logs.
Must be at least 1 when provided.

processing_order.description:
MessagesProcessingOrder defines the order in which messages are processed.
Valid values are "LIFO" or "FIFO".

send_interval_max.description:
SendIntervalMax is the maximum interval between message sends (in seconds).
Must be at least 1 when provided and greater than or equal to SendIntervalMin.

send_interval_min.description:
SendIntervalMin is the minimum interval between message sends (in seconds).
Must be at least 1 when provided.

sim_selection_mode.description:
SimSelectionMode defines how SIM cards are selected for sending messages.
Valid values are "OSDefault", "RoundRobin", or "Random".

interval_seconds.description:
IntervalSeconds is the interval between ping requests (in seconds).
Must be at least 1 when provided.

internet_required.description: InternetRequired indicates whether internet access is required for webhooks.

retry_count.description:
RetryCount is the number of times to retry failed webhook deliveries.
Must be at least 1 when provided.

signing_key.description: SigningKey is the secret key used for signing webhook payloads. Must not be used with Cloud Server.

deviceId.description: The unique identifier of the device the webhook is associated with.

event.description: The type of event the webhook is triggered for.

id.description: The unique identifier of the webhook.

url.description: The URL the webhook will be sent to.

id.description: The unique identifier of the webhook event.

webhookId.description: The identifier of the webhook configuration that triggered this event.

deviceId.description: The unique identifier of the device.

event.description: The type of event that triggered the webhook.

payload.description: The data associated with the event.

message.description: The content of the SMS message received.

receivedAt.description: The timestamp when the SMS message was received.

messageId.description: The unique identifier of the SMS message.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the sender (for incoming messages) or recipient (for outgoing messages).

sender.description: The phone number of the message sender. For incoming messages, this is the external sender; for outgoing messages, this is the device's phone number. May be `null` for device's phone number.

destination.description: The phone number of the message recipient. For incoming messages, this is the device's/SIM's phone number that received the message; for outgoing messages, this is the recipient's phone number. May be `null` for device's phone number.

simNumber.description: The SIM card number that sent or received the SMS. May be `null` if the SIM cannot be determined or the default was used.

sentAt.description: The timestamp when the SMS message was sent.

deliveredAt.description: The timestamp when the SMS message was delivered.

failedAt.description: The timestamp when the SMS message failed.

data.description: Base64-encoded content of the SMS message received.

receivedAt.description: The timestamp when the SMS message was received.
The timestamp when the MMS message was received.
